messagebar.description: p Here is how the full example of Messages page where it can be used together with Messages:
body: text: 'Hi there, I am also fine, thanks! And how are you?',
text: 'Hey, Blue Ninja! Glad to see you ;)',
if (!previousMessage || previousMessage.type !== message.type || previousMessage.name !== message.name) return true;
if (!nextMessage || nextMessage.type !== message.type || nextMessage.name !== message.name) return true;
if (!nextMessage || nextMessage.type !== message.type || nextMessage.name !== message.name) return true;

messages.description: p Here is how the full example of Messages page where it can be used together with Messagebar:
body: text: 'Hi there, I am also fine, thanks! And how are you?',
text: 'Hey, Blue Ninja! Glad to see you ;)',
if (!previousMessage || previousMessage.type !== message.type || previousMessage.name !== message.name) return true;
if (!nextMessage || nextMessage.type !== message.type || nextMessage.name !== message.name) return true;
if (!nextMessage || nextMessage.type !== message.type || nextMessage.name !== message.name) return true;

Photo Browser suppots 2 default themes - default Light (like in previous examples) and Dark theme. Here is a Dark theme examples:

With app.preloader.show() you can show small overlay with preloader indicator.
With app.dialog.preloader() you can show dialog modal with preloader indicator.
With app.dialog.preloader('My text...') you can show dialog preloader modal with custom title.
When progress bar is determinate it indicates how long an operation will take when the percentage complete is detectable.
Overlay with determinate progress bar on top of the app:
When progress bar is infinite/indeterminate it requests that the user wait while something finishes when its not necessary to indicate how long it will take.
Overlay with infinite progress bar on top of the app
Overlay with infinite multi-color progress bar on top of the app

<f7-block-header>Pressing and holding one of its buttons increments or decrements the steppers value repeatedly. With dynamic autorepeat, the rate of change depends on how long the user continues pressing the control.</f7-block-header>
<f7-block-header>In wraps mode incrementing beyond maximum value sets value to minimum value, likewise, decrementing below minimum value sets value to maximum value</f7-block-header>

<f7-block-header>It is possible to enter value manually from keyboard or mobile keypad. When click on input field, stepper enter into manual input mode, which allow type value from keyboar and check fractional part with defined accurancy. Click outside or enter Return key, ending manual mode.</f7-block-header>

virtual-list.description: p Here is the full page example with Virtual List and Searchbar to search through Virtual List items:
body: Virtual List allows to render lists with huge amount of elements without loss of performance. And it is fully compatible with all Framework7 list components such as Search Bar, Infinite Scroll, Pull To Refresh, Swipeouts (swipe-to-delete) and Sortable.
Here is the example of virtual list with 10 000 items:
